title: 110_s1891
content: IMMUNITY FOR REPORTS OF SUSPECTED TERRORIST ACTIVITY OR SUSPICIOUS BEHAVIOR AND RESPONSE. Immunity is granted to individuals who report suspected terrorist activity or suspicious behavior in good faith and based on reasonable suspicion. They are protected from civil liability under any law for making such reports, unless the report is knowingly false or made recklessly. Authorized officials who respond to covered activity with reasonable and good faith actions also have qualified immunity from civil liability. Authorized officials responding to reported activity in good faith are granted qualified immunity from civil liability under applicable law. Immune individuals can recover reasonable costs and attorney fees if found immune from civil liability. Authorized officials responding to suspicious activities are granted immunity from civil liability and can recover costs and attorney fees if found immune. The term "authorized official" includes employees or agents of transportation systems, Department of Homeland Security, Department of Transportation, Department of Justice, and law enforcement officers. Covered activities refer to suspicious transactions, activities, or occurrences. The term "covered activity" refers to any suspicious transaction, activity, or occurrence involving a passenger transportation system or vehicle indicating a potential violation of law related to threats to passenger safety, security, or terrorism. Passenger transportation includes public transportation, over-the-road bus transportation, school bus transportation, and intercity passenger rail transportation. Passenger transportation encompasses various modes such as public transportation, over-the-road bus, school bus, intercity passenger rail, passenger vessel, waterborne transportation, and air transportation. A passenger transportation system is an entity providing passenger transportation using vehicles and related infrastructure. The term "passenger transportation system" refers to an entity organized to provide passenger transportation using vehicles and infrastructure. The term "vehicle" is defined as per section 1992(16) of title 18, United States Code. This section will be effective immediately upon enactment and applies to all activities and claims occurring after that date.
